Hey-yo! Nice to meet you! You can all call me Shima! I'm just a lame ol' college graduate who arts for her own entertainment. Basically this is a dorky blog that contains all my silly art and stories, so feel free to look around. My ask box is always open, so please don't hesitate to come ask me about anything you'd like! (In fact, I encourage it!)

summary: Pokemon Card of the Day #1295: Charizard (Arceus)
title: Pokemon Card of the Day #1295: Charizard (Arceus)
body:
Charizard cards have almost always been about absurd Energy costs, huge damage, and a ridiculous amount of discarding. This one? Not so much. This one was much more reasonable as far as Energy and discarding was concerned, quickly making it one of the most interesting Charizard cards in many years. Being better than other Charizard didn’t mean that much in the TCG, but it was hard to ignore what this card brought to the table.

140 HP was very nice, even on a Stage 2. The +30 Water Weakness was a problem against Kingdra and especially Gyarados, which could actually KO at full power with an Expert Belt. On the other hand, there was the -20 Fighting Resistance which not only mattered, but worked against Machamp since it wasn’t a Basic Pokemon. The Retreat Cost was a bit high though, at 3 Energy, so having a bit of help was nice,

Fire Formation was really cool. Each of Charizard’s attacks did 10 more damage for each Fire-type Pokemon on your Bench to your opponent’s Active Pokemon. This was also done before applying Weakness and Resistance. A few Fire-types, such as other Charizard or maybe Ninetales from HGSS, could turn Charizard into a devastating attacker.

Fire Wing was only 30 damage, but the price was only a Fire Energy. It also required no discarding, so it was nice as a finishing move. There was also use for this against something like Jumpluff, since some Fire-types on the Bench could make this do just enough to KO.

Burning Tail’s 80 damage for 3 Energy was good enough as it was, though it wasn’t as amazing when you had to discard that Fire Energy. Add in boosts from Fire Formation and you had a legitimately scary attack that compared to some of the best out there.

Charizard was one of the more dangerous attackers when it got going. It was somewhat overshadowed as a Fire-type by Blaziken FB LV.X and the like, but it was a very viable option. The thing keeping it from the top was probably that it did need a bunch of Bench spaces taken up by Fire-types to be truly great, and that meant that there was less room for standard supporting Pokemon than other decks. Charizard was still very much a competitive option despite that, however, and was one of the best Charizard cards in the TCG.

Here I post fandom stuff, Steampunk stuff, Goth stuff, Social Justice stuff, some attempts at funny text posts and just general stuff I like. Use the gears up there to ask me stuff, send me stuff or to see a list of useful links. Have fun!

blog.name: notnormalmydude
blog.title: Pokemon Sun, Moon and Violence
blog.description: Insanity the likes of which Alola has never seen

summary: And if you feel guilty about something, others might suspect you knew something... ------------------------------------- Hau: Ok...
caption:
And if you feel guilty about something, others might suspect you knew something…

————————————-

Hau: Ok we’re out of earshot of Makaio… What’s really bothering you about this?
Lillie: I just… We trusted Phyco when he first got here. He gave us no reason to distrust him or the other Ultra Recon members. Then the thing with Nero and…
Hau: All those things he said to Zossie and Gladion while they were dating and engaged. Saying “they shouldn’t get married” and “he wouldn’t allow it”… Even though their boss said it was great and he encouraged it
Lillie: All that stress… It couldn’t have been healthy. Just like Baloo, I do not believe in coincidence

Hau: Me neither. That “excuse” we were given didn’t sit right at all. Zossie was out of her mind worried what Phyco could do. Gladion wouldn’t have been as pissed if it was
Lillie: I feel bad Hau… They were so happy and it should have stayed that way! That never should have happened. I thought the hard times were over for Gladion
Hau: Me too… But we won’t let anything else happen. Ok?
Lillie: Yeah..! I won’t let anything happen to him, not if I can help it
